slides.title: What is Mechanical Engineering?
slides.content:
# Moving Parts ‚öôÔ∏è

The branch of engineering dealing with the design, construction, and use of machines.
- Anything that moves: Cars, Robots, Engines, HVAC systems.

slides.title: Mechanics of Materials
slides.content:
# Strength & Stress üèãÔ∏è

How materials deform under load.
- **Stress**: Force per unit area.
- **Strain**: Deformation.
- **Elasticity**: Returning to original shape (Spring).
- **Plasticity**: Permenant deformation (Bent metal).

slides.title: Thermodynamics
slides.content:
# Heat Power üî•

Energy conversion.
- **1st Law**: Energy cannot be created/destroyed.
- **2nd Law**: Entropy increases (Perpetual motion is impossible).
- Applications: Car engines, Refrigerators, Power plants.

slides.title: Fluid Mechanics
slides.content:
# Flow üåä

How liquids and gases move.
- **Aerodynamics**: Airflow over cars/planes.
- **Hydraulics**: Using fluid pressure to lift heavy loads (Excavators).
- **Bernoulli's Principle**: Faster fluid $\to$ Lower pressure (Why planes fly).

slides.title: Kinematics of Machinery
slides.content:
# Geometry of Motion üìê

Analyzing motion without considering forces.
- **Linkages**: Connecting bars to create movement paths.
- **Cams**: Converting rotating motion to linear motion (Valves in engine).

slides.title: Law Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which law states that energy cannot be created or destroyed?

slides.title: Manufacturing Processes
slides.content:
# Making Things üè≠

- **Casting**: Pouring molten metal into mold.
- **Machining**: Cutting away material (Lathe, Mill).
- **Forging**: Hammering hot metal (Stronger).
- **3D Printing**: Adding material layer by layer.

slides.title: Gears
slides.content:
# Torque vs Speed ‚öôÔ∏è

- **Small driving Big**: Increases Torque (Strength), decreases Speed.
- **Big driving Small**: Increases Speed, decreases Torque.
- Types: Spur, Helical, Bevel, Worm.

slides.title: Internal Combustion Engine
slides.content:
# 4 Strokes üöó

1. **Intake**: Fuel/Air in.
2. **Compression**: Squeeze it.
3. **Combustion**: Bang! (Power stroke).
4. **Exhaust**: Smoke out.
"Suck, Squeeze, Bang, Blow".

slides.title: Bearings
slides.content:
# Smooth Spin ‚õ∏Ô∏è

Reducing friction between moving parts.
- **Ball Bearings**: Rolling spheres.
- **Roller Bearings**: Rolling cylinders (High load).
- Without them, machines would grind to a halt.

slides.title: CAD / CAM
slides.content:
# Digital Design üíª

- **CAD**: Computer Aided Design (Drawing in 3D).
- **CAM**: Computer Aided Manufacturing (Robots building from CAD).
- Replaced drafting tables.

slides.title: Heat Transfer
slides.content:
# Cooling Down ‚ùÑÔ∏è

removing heat from where it's not wanted.
- **Conduction**: Through solid (Processor to heatsink).
- **Convection**: Through fluid/air (Fan blowing).
- **Radiation**: Through space (Sun).

slides.title: Force Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which system uses liquid pressure to lift heavy loads?

slides.title: Vibrations
slides.content:
# Shake üì≥

Oscillations in machines.
- Can destroy structures (Resonance).
- Engineers design "Dampers" to absorb energy.
- Important for bridges and tall buildings.

slides.title: Finite Element Analysis (FEA)
slides.content:
# Simulation üéÆ

Using computers to simulate stress/heat on a part.
- Breaks complex shape into millions of tiny cubes.
- "Will this bridge beak?" (Test on PC before building).

slides.title: HVAC
slides.content:
# Air Control üå°Ô∏è

Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning.
- Managing Temperature, Humidity, and Air Quality.
- Critical for skyscrapers and hospitals.

slides.title: Turbomachinery
slides.content:
# Spinners üåÄ

Machines that transfer energy between rotor and fluid.
- **Turbines**: Fluid $\to$ Energy (Jet engine, Power plant).
- **Pumps/Compressors**: Energy $\to$ Fluid.

slides.title: Mechatronics
slides.content:
# Integration ü§ñ

Merging Mechanical with Electronics and Code.
- Anti-lock Brakes (ABS).
- Drones.
- Modern cars are computers on wheels.

slides.title: Mech Eng Summary
slides.content:
# Recap üìù

- **Forces** and **Materials** dictate design.
- **Heat** and **Energy** power movement.
- Precise manufacturing builds our world.
